attributes.action: Review the need for drug consumptions rooms in Scotland and related policy
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.emcdda.europa.eu/system/files/publications/2734/POD_Drug%20consumption%20rooms.pdf

Journal article - BMJ 2019;366:l4906 - 'could drug consumption rooms save lives?'

http://www.sdf.org.uk/cross-party-support-for-drug-consumption-rooms-to-be-introduced-across-the-uk/

https://idhdp.com/media/399959/drug-consumption-in-europe-final-2014-1.pdf
attributes.background: Given the number of drug deaths in Scotland that continue to increase I think it is important to re-visit this proposal that was previously declined by the uk government. Evidence from other countries shows that such services can greatly help a vulnerable population and be beneficial for society.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as devolving powers to the Scottish Government to allow them to set up drug consumption rooms.  Or you might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548575
